## Natural history notes

Yellow hatpins (Syngonanthus flavidulus) is a perennial plant native to the Southeastern United States. Although the common name is Yellow Hatpins, the flowers on this plant are typically white, appearing as small buttons from February to July. A facultative wetland plant, Yellow Hatpins occur on pond margins and in wet soils in Pine flatwoods and Florida scrub habitats.
